result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason W Liesenfeld was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No contact with victim, her family, no unsupervised contact with any minor females.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber, release for work, treatment and court appearances.  Court STAYS 10 of the 20 days, to commence 10/3/2015 at 5:00 p.m.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jason W Liesenfeld in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Victim makes statements.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Dvorak plays an audio clip.  Attorney Dvorak makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following: Count #1
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of: 

75 days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  
Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with victim, her family, no unsupervised contact with any minor females.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge
Condition Time: 20 days HUBER, release for work, treatment and court appearances.  Court stays 10 of the 20 days; sentence is to commence Saturday 10/3/2015 @ 5:00 pm 
COSTS:  $ 243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $200.00  to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
CD submitted by Atty Dvorak, labeled Sentencing Clip-Stored in exhibit room.
Defendant Jason W Liesenfeld in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jason W Liesenfeld in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Konrad Paczuski, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is awaiting video.  State has ordered it from the department.  Hearing scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness or her family listed in the Criminal Complaint. No unsupervised contact with any minors except for his own children.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol including in his residence.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Jason W Liesenfeld in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
